snippet: Coalition representatives meeting in Istanbul chose Ghassan Hitto, 50, who emigrated from Syria and until recently lived in Texas, to head a planned interim government.
abstract: Syria's main exile opposition coalition elects Ghassan Hitto, naturalized Syrian-born American citizen, to be first prime minister of interim Syrian government, charged with funneling aid to rebels inside Syria and offering alternative to government of Pres Bashar al-Assad.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Hania Mourtada and Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Rick Gladstone from New York, and Hala Droubi from Dubai, United Arab Emirates.

lead_paragraph: Coalition representatives meeting in Istanbul chose Ghassan Hitto, 50, who emigrated from Syria and until recently lived in Texas, to head a planned interim government.

headline.seo: Syrian Opposition Picks Ghassan Hitto as Interim Prime Minister
headline.main:
Syrian Rebels Pick
U.S. Citizen to Lead
Interim Government
headline.print_headline: Syrian Rebels Choose Naturalized American to Lead Interim Government
